intro: Miconia donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Hawaiian miconia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Miconia donnell-smithii is notable for its ecological significance in Hawaiian forests, though it is also considered an invasive species in some regions.
